posts.post_content:
This is what I like to see as a Planeswalker. She's very good, but costs enough to not warp the metagame around her.  
  
The +1 ability is great, and since she can protect herself, I think she'll see decent play in control and maybe midrange decks that run blue.  
  
The -2 is strong, and can be used 2 turn in a row right away if she survives. Imagine drawing 3 or 4 cards per turn with it. Not too difficult to set us with [Lingering Souls](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lingering Souls) or the new [Entreat the Angels](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Entreat the Angels).  
  
And for the finisher, I won't say how good it is, just list some great cards to use with it that might not be obvious.  
[Tome Scour](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tome Scour): Draw 5 for U.  
[Time Warp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Time Warp): Take infinite turns. (kinda obvious I guess)  
[Wild Cantor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wild Cantor): Infinite Storm count into [Grapeshot](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grapeshot)  
[Fauna Shaman](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fauna Shaman): Don't worry about whatever you just discarded.  
[Giant Growth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Giant Growth): Massive pump.  
  
She's not as broken a... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content:
I've had so much fun playing Tamiyo. Her +1 is enough to swing a lot of games my way, either by keeping a threat from attacking or blocking, or by messing up my opponent's mana base. Still, I'm not going to lie. The reason I love the card so much is that her ultimate is just really, really cool. As a lot of people have said, there are many ways to end the game after getting the Tamiyo emblem out. Here's one I haven't seen yet:  
  
[Mind Over Matter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mind Over Matter)

Posted By: Himborg (5/18/2012 7:47:11 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I had never preordered a card before Tamiyo. I can't say I'm disappointed, she's everything I thought she could be.  
  
I've been playing her in an Esper tapout deck with Gideon and Lingering Souls. Lingering Souls buys you time and interacts well with her -2. Gideon turns dudes sideways and then you draw even more.  
  
I have drawn 17 cards in 1 turn off her -2 ability. My opponent cast Spider Spawning into my Gideon. After flashing it back and with my Gideon at 1 loyalty I cast Tamiyo. The next turn I shrugged off my dead Gideon as I proceeded to draw 17. Needles to say, I found the wrath I needed and then some.  
  
As others have said, her ultimate is insane but does not immediately end the game. I did have an opponent concede when I showed them my hand of Day of Judgment and Mana Leak with her emblem in play, however.
posts.html:
I had never preordered a card before Tamiyo. I can't say I'm disappointed, she's everything I thought she could be.

I've been playing her in an Esper tapout deck with Gideon and Lingering Souls. Lingering Souls buys you time and interacts well with her -2. Gideon turns dudes sideways and then you draw even more.

I have drawn 17 cards in 1 turn off her -2 ability. My opponent cast Spider Spawning into my Gideon. After flashing it back and with my Gideon at 1 loyalty I cast Tamiyo. The next turn I shrugged off my dead Gideon as I proceeded to draw 17. Needles to say, I found the wrath I needed and then some.

As others have said, her ultimate is insane but does not immediately end the game. I did have an opponent concede when I showed them my hand of Day of Judgment and Mana Leak with her emblem in play, however.

Posted By: zombieord (5/27/2012 11:53:36 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Love this card! Tamiyo is such a beautiful, interesting character, and everything about this card captures her perfectly--her abilities, artwork, etc.  
  
So, the card itself from a purely Melvin (mechanical) perspective is pretty alright too! I've had some good luck with her in my control deck so far. Her +1 can tap down their big threat. Or, if they're swarming with little dudes, then I can use her -2 to dig for a sweeper.  
  
Of course her ultimate is nuts. There are any number of crazily awesome things that can be done with it (infinite counterspells, board sweepers, kill spells, Lingering Souls, card draw, etc.), but you really can't count on that happening. And watch out for Zealous Conscr-ipts if/when you get her to 8! :O
posts.html:
Love this card! Tamiyo is such a beautiful, interesting character, and everything about this card captures her perfectly--her abilities, artwork, etc.

So, the card itself from a purely Melvin (mechanical) perspective is pretty alright too! I've had some good luck with her in my control deck so far. Her +1 can tap down their big threat. Or, if they're swarming with little dudes, then I can use her -2 to dig for a sweeper.

Of course her ultimate is nuts. There are any number of crazily awesome things that can be done with it (infinite counterspells, board sweepers, kill spells, Lingering Souls, card draw, etc.), but you really can't count on that happening. posts.post_content:
Oh come on...why do people think getting her -8 isn't feasible?  
  
ANY decent white/blue player can delay the game for at least 5 turns even without her +1's help  
  
Does no one really remember the time when people thought [Luminarch Ascension](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Luminarch Ascension) was crap, then suddenly it became very viable????  
  
Then try to do that 4 turns with Tamiyo but instead of angels you'll be getting infinite [Cyclonic Rift](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cyclonic Rift)s, infinite [Unsummon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Unsummon)s, even infinite [Dissipate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dissipate)s

posts.post_content:
She is my favorite card in Avacyn restored. An incredibly good Blue planeswalker; not as good as [Jace, the Mind Sculptor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jace, the Mind Sculptor), but better, in my opinion, than [Jace, Memory Adept](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jace, Memory Adept). Pretty too. 10/10 and 5/5.  
  
Breakdown of her abilities:  
+1: [Frost Titan](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Frost Titan)'s ETB Effect.  
-2: [Borrowing 100,000 Arrows](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Borrowing 100,000 Arrows).  
-8: [Praetor's Counsel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Praetor's Counsel) for every card hereafter.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
Her second ability works well with the RTR card [Blustersquall](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blustersquall).
